page.title: 20CLUBS(2)
page.content: The British Legion with its premises in the High Street is both a welfare and a social club. Its main task is to look after the needs of ex-Servicemen of two World wars and their dependants The Branch keeps a careful watch on those in need and does a great deal of effective welfare work. The social side of the club is very popular. The clubhouse is well equipped and has two snooker tables,a pool table and bowling alley. The Scouts and Guides together with their junior branches the Cubs and Brownies have a thriving following in the area. The Scouts meet at St Catharine's and the Guides at the Youth Club, Centre 65. At present the Scouts and Guides are busily raising money to build themselves a Clubhouse. Centre 65 is the Youth Club on the campus of Campden School.
